data.text: Maybe a 700c wheeled touring bike. You don't need to put racks on it and you can still use bikepacking bags if you want. If you did want to put racks on it, and touring bags, you have that option in the future. The gravel bikes are great but can have limited gearing if you are going to climb very steep hills. If you ever wanted to put racks on it, you would be limited to a rear rack. Road bikes are usually designed for head down, bum up riding; which may not be what you are looking for. The tires are often skinny and can limit you to well surfaced roads. My 2c.

data.text: 700c 40 and its a 1x. Had a 42t up front originally but dropped it to a 38t to go with the 11-42 11 speed cassette. I can spin out easily but it climbs well and makes me go slower and appreciate where I am. Best thing I did was going tubeless especially when you can drop the pressures all the way down for extra comfort.

data.text: There needs to be more information to give a better idea of what type of bike would be a good option. Terrain? Road, gravel, both? Support vehicle? Solo or with others? Comfort vs speed? Typical Miles per day desired? What type of bike are you currently use to riding? Do you want this bike solely for these tours or for other types of riding too(ie: century rides, trail riding, fast group riding, etc). I can go on and on, but, I notice people are just saying what they think without knowing what YOU really are wanting and using it for
